If a vector space has a finite basis, then it is finite-dimensional.

type:
∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V] {ι : Type w}
  [inst_3 : Finite ι], Basis ι K V → FiniteDimensional K V
name: FiniteDimensional.of_fintype_basis
docString: If a vector space has a finite basis, then it is finite-dimensional.

If a vector space has a basis indexed by elements of a finite set, then it is
finite-dimensional.

type:
∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V] {ι : Type w}
  {s : Set ι}, Basis (↑s) K V → s.Finite → FiniteDimensional K V
name: FiniteDimensional.of_finite_basis
docString:
If a vector space has a basis indexed by elements of a finite set, then it is
finite-dimensional.

A subspace of a finite-dimensional space is also finite-dimensional.

type:
∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V]
  [inst_3 : FiniteDimensional K V] (S : Submodule K V), FiniteDimensional K ↥S
name: FiniteDimensional.finiteDimensional_submodule
docString: A subspace of a finite-dimensional space is also finite-dimensional.

A finite dimensional vector space over a finite field is finite

type:
∀ (R : Type u_1) {M : Type u_4} [inst : Semiring R] [inst_1 : AddCommMonoid M] [inst_2 : Module R M] [inst_3 : Finite R]
  [inst : Module.Finite R M], Finite M
name: FiniteDimensional.fintypeOfFintype
docString: A finite dimensional vector space over a finite field is finite

If a vector space is `FiniteDimensional`, all bases are indexed by a finite type

type:
{K : Type u} →
  {V : Type v} →
    [inst : DivisionRing K] →
      [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] →
        [inst_2 : Module K V] → {ι : Type u_1} → [inst_3 : FiniteDimensional K V] → Basis ι K V → Fintype ι
name: FiniteDimensional.fintypeBasisIndex
docString: If a vector space is `FiniteDimensional`, all bases are indexed by a finite type

A vector space has dimension `1` if and only if there is a
single non-zero vector of which all vectors are multiples.

type:
∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : Ring K] [inst_1 : StrongRankCondition K] [inst_2 : AddCommGroup V]
  [inst_3 : Module K V] [inst_4 : Module.Free K V], Module.rank K V = 1 ↔ ∃ v₀, v₀ ≠ 0 ∧ ∀ (v : V), ∃ r, r • v₀ = v
name: rank_eq_one_iff
docString:
A vector space has dimension `1` if and only if there is a
single non-zero vector of which all vectors are multiples.

A vector space has dimension at most `1` if and only if there is a
single vector of which all vectors are multiples.

type:
∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : Ring K] [inst_1 : StrongRankCondition K] [inst_2 : AddCommGroup V]
  [inst_3 : Module K V] [inst_4 : Module.Free K V], Module.rank K V ≤ 1 ↔ ∃ v₀, ∀ (v : V), ∃ r, r • v₀ = v
name: rank_le_one_iff
docString:
A vector space has dimension at most `1` if and only if there is a
single vector of which all vectors are multiples.

If a vector space is finite-dimensional, then the cardinality of any basis is equal to its
`finrank`.

type:
∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V]
  [inst_3 : FiniteDimensional K V] {ι : Type w}, Basis ι K V → ↑(Module.finrank K V) = Cardinal.mk ι
name: Module.finrank_eq_card_basis'
docString:
If a vector space is finite-dimensional, then the cardinality of any basis is equal to its
`finrank`.

If a vector space has a finite dimension, the index set of `Basis.ofVectorSpace` is finite.

type:
∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V],
  Module.rank K V < Cardinal.aleph0 → (Basis.ofVectorSpaceIndex K V).Finite
name: Basis.finite_ofVectorSpaceIndex_of_rank_lt_aleph0
docString: If a vector space has a finite dimension, the index set of `Basis.ofVectorSpace` is finite.

The `vectorSpan` of a finite set is finite-dimensional.

type:
∀ (k : Type u_1) {V : Type u_2} {P : Type u_3} [inst : DivisionRing k] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module k V]
  [inst_3 : AddTorsor V P] {s : Set P}, s.Finite → FiniteDimensional k ↥(vectorSpan k s)
name: finiteDimensional_vectorSpan_of_finite
docString: The `vectorSpan` of a finite set is finite-dimensional.
